name: biomni-design-verification-primers
title: Biomni: Design Verification Primers
description: Design Sanger sequencing primers to verify plasmid regions
content:
Overview

This tool designs Sanger sequencing verification primers to confirm the correctness of specific regions in plasmids. It automatically calculates the optimal number and positions of primers needed to achieve complete coverage of a target region, accounting for typical Sanger read lengths (~800 bp). The tool ensures primers meet standard quality criteria for successful sequencing reactions.

Input Parameters

  • plasmid_sequence: Complete plasmid DNA sequence (string)
  • start: Target region start position, 0-based (integer)
  • end: Target region end position (integer)
  • --linear: Optional flag indicating plasmid is linear (default: circular)
  • --coverage-length: Typical Sanger read length per primer in bp (default: 800)
  • --primer-length: Length of designed primers in bp (default: 20)

Biological Use Case

Critical for quality control in molecular cloning:

  • Verify correctness of cloned inserts after transformation
  • Confirm sequence integrity of newly constructed plasmids
  • Validate site-directed mutagenesis results
  • Check for unwanted mutations after PCR amplification
  • Quality control for plasmids before large-scale experiments
  • Verify commercially synthesized gene constructs

Output

Returns a parameters (verification_primers.json) containing multiple primer sequences with positions, Tm values, and coverage information to span the entire target region.

Category

molecular_biology
